availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Owen Glass Jr. (Henderson County, Kentucky, resident and prov govt)

body.p: Henderson County, Kentucky, resident and provisional government convention member. Kentucky native. Son of Owen Glass Sr. and Elizabeth H. Glass. Resident in Henderson, Kentucky, in 1850. Household owned thirteen enslaved persons in Henderson in 1860. Resident in Henderson County in 1860. Household owned thirteen enslaved persons in Princeton in 1860. Member of the convention of the provisional government held at Russellville in November 1861.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Henderson County, District 1, p. 277A.

Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Henderson County, Division 1, p. 152B.
